ServiceConnection
public
Ultraleap.​TouchFree.​Tooling.​Connection.​ServiceConnection

This represents a connection to a TouchFree Service. It should be created by a ConnectionManager to ensure there is only one active connection at a time. The sending and receiving of data to the client is handled here.

Variables
webSocket
WebSocket webSocket

A reference to the websocket we are connected to.

Functions
ServiceConnection
internal ServiceConnection(
string _ip =  "127.0.0.1",
string _port =  "9739"
)

The constructor for ServiceConnection that can be given a different IP Address and Port to connect to on construction. This constructor also redirects incoming messages to OnMessage. Once the websocket connection opens, a handshake request is sent with this Client's API version number. The service will not send data over an open connection until this handshake is completed succesfully.

ConnectionResultCallback
private void ConnectionResultCallback(
WebSocketResponse response
)

Passed into SendMessage as part of connecting to TouchFree Service, handles the result of the Version Checking handshake.

Disconnect
public void Disconnect()

Can be used to force the connection to the webSocket to be closed.

OnMessage
public void OnMessage(
MessageEventArgs _message
)

The first point of contact for new messages received, these are sorted into appropriate types based on their ActionCode and added to queues on the ConnectionManager's MessageReceiver.

SendMessage
internal void SendMessage(
string _message,
string _requestID,
Action<WebSocketResponse> _callback
)

Used internally to send or request information from the Service via the webSocket. To be given a pre-made _message and _requestID. Provides an asynchronous WebSocketResponse via the _callback parameter.

RequestConfigState
internal void RequestConfigState(
Action<ConfigState> _callback
)

Used internally to request a ConfigState from the Service via the webSocket.  Provides an asynchronous ConfigState via the _callback parameter.
